Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can draw two students holding cups with a string connecting them to represent a string telephone.
The student can attempt to show sound traveling along the string, possibly with lines or arrows.
The student can depict the two students as engaged in communication, suggesting the basic idea of a working string telephone (e.g., one student speaking, the other listening).
CANNOT: The student may not accurately illustrate how sound travels along the string, possibly forgetting to connect the lines completely (student might not understand sound transmission).
The student might not show that the device is made using standard materials (e.g., could draw solid rods instead of a string).
The student might not include or misrepresent a simple explanation or indication of communication over a distance (e.g., thinking the string is used only for connection, not sound transmission).
